title: Charles-Tim
author: Charles-Tim
created_time: January 11, 2023, 06:40:49 PMLast edit: January 14, 2023, 08:56:00 PM by Charles-Tim
content: I am always surprised that no bitcoin node runner in Nigeria, but I can be wrong because a node runner can use Tor to anonymise the country IP address connection provided by ISP, but according to https://bitnodes.io/, no Nigeria node runner using IP address. Although, for privacy, Tor is advisable, especially for those that are running full node on their full client wallet, like Bitcoin Core.But about running a lightning network node, I am happy that this is coming from Nigeria:Quote from: https://twitter.com/FreeRoutingAf/status/1612781793576361984?s=20&t=JefpBdWZ5gwQ4W3SNzkLLgThe lightning network is now alive and routing on the ground in Lagos .Please share and support us by opening a channel to us: https://t.co/nClBZbW4zAAlthough, running an onchain node do not come with incentive, but running a lightning node comes with incentive.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on January 11, 2023, 06:40:49 PMI am always surprised that no bitcoin node runner in Nigeria, but I can be wrong because a node runner can use Tor to anonymise the country IP address connection provided by ISP, It may be funny, but sometime last year I asked a search engine "if it is possible to earn a passive income running a Bitcoin node." The answer I got confirmed it was a no, but it can only come with a little reward. @Charls-Tim I will be glad if you provide me with better knowledge about that. Perhaps this time around, people are looking for what can earn them a living, so I won't be surprised if no Bitcoin node is running in Nigeria. According to Finder's latest report on cryptocurrency ownership and adoption, it shows that Nigeria has the second highest number of Bitcoin owners as of October 2022, at 48%. Possibly there could also be a Bitcoin node running in Nigeria, but it would use an IP and have its privacy protected.QuoteI am happy that this is coming from Nigeria:https://twitter.com/FreeRoutingAf/status/1612781793576361984?s=20&t=JefpBdWZ5gwQ4W3SNzkLLg]The lightning network is now alive and routing on the ground in Lagos .I am happy with their progress as well; over the past few days, they confirmed having reached 7 BTC in total capacity. It's a welcome development.

comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on January 12, 2023, 12:58:48 PMIt may be funny, but sometime last year I asked a search engine "if it is possible to earn a passive income running a Bitcoin node." The answer I got confirmed it was a no, but it can only come with a little reward. @Charls-Tim I will be glad if you provide me with better knowledge about that. To run bitcoin (onchain) node, there is no reward for it, but the reward that may be referred to is privacy, because if you run your own node using full client like Bitcoin Core with Tor, you will have privacy like not connecting to a central server that will know your IP address and wallet addresses. But some people run their own node to make bitcoin more decentralized, to help in the decentralized network. But lightning node operator can earn incentive from fee.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: This is a tough one because it is in an environment that is unfavourable. First, I imagine the amount of money he has to spend everyday on petrol just to ensure the node it running and active. Aside this, the possibility for this is quite limitless especially for payments. If we can have just two or more active nodes and then Nigerian bitcoiners gets connected to it, it will be great but them how many Nigerians know how to connect to the nodes? There is a lot of work that needs to be done in this area. QuoteFree Bitcoin lightning payments node for Nigeria. Please be aware that NigeriaFreeRouting is in Lagos which has its challenges... The node is running on an old laptop, with a diesel generator over a crazy expensive and not always reliable mobile connection. So it might not always have 100% uptime like AfricaFreeRouting which is hosted in a fancy data centre. But this is life in Africa and at least we are on the ground and routing and can now work to improve our setup as we grow and are able to afford better. We are grateful for your support Source: https://amboss.space/node/023b3ec101c9ab4e060b345d7d6b1728f5ca2db1e21bda9a88f2b9f6b1a3825ef9

comments.author: sokani
comments.created_time: January 13, 2023, 02:49:19 PMLast edit: January 13, 2023, 04:42:10 PM by sokani
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on January 12, 2023, 12:58:48 PMI am happy with their progress as well; over the past few days, they confirmed having reached 7 BTC in total capacity. It's a welcome development. If they can get up to 7 BTC from when they started mining to this very moment, then it is worth it.****EDITED*****I had to go do some googling & reading and the 7 BTC they said the are able to get as reward is wrong or should I say it doesn't make sense to me. From what I understand, Bitcoin rewards the first miner who receives the new transaction and records it. Let's say Cryptopreneurbrainboss wants to send 1 BTC to Igebotz. The first miner to receive this transaction, cross checks it to see if Brainboss actually has 1 BTC in his wallet and sends it to other nodes who receives and verify the transaction details. After verification, it is sent to a memory poll that has many bitcoin transactions from other users. The miner who first receives the transaction and solves it is rewarded with btc and the current rate is 6.25 BTC per block, so how do they arrived at 7 BTC?Note: The 6.25 BTC is Bitcoin halvening and you can find more about it here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5416002.0

And if I node runner is not using the country IP address then it will be wrong because the IP address will identify the location where the node is running but as for me I like bitcoin core.

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on January 12, 2023, 02:56:57 PMBut some people run their own node to make bitcoin more decentralized, to help in the decentralized network.This is the most important reason of running a note. You can only be known as a pioneer Bitcoiner by running a node so that you can be able to make bitcoin decisions. Apart from this, running a node guarantees you another level of privacy in bitcoin.
